page.title: 19RHYMNEY-LIFE STYLES
page.content: Rhymney is a good example of a Welsh valley community founded upon by-gone industries of iron,coal and brewing.T- races remain in small mines,a Welsh Parish Church built by a brewer, a dozen public houses and clubs and a new History Museum.A small attractive park provides rugby,cricket,soccer, bowls and tennis.A golf club and lofts for racing pigeons also offer outdoors activities.A comprehensive school gives education up to A level and in the winter has a wide range of evening classes.Centres are in constant use for social concerts,guild meetings,scouting and guiding.Culture is encouraged by the Silurian Male Choir,an Art Society,a Youth Band,a library and many bi-lingual churches and chapels.Rhymney is well served by frequent trains from Cardiff and also local buses.
